001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetDescriptor;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
012import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
013import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor;
014import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Image;
015import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Label;
016import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Align;
017import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable;
018import regexodus.ds.CharCharMap;
019import squidpony.IColorCenter;
020import squidpony.Maker;
021import squidpony.StringKit;
022import squidpony.squidmath.NumberTools;
023import squidpony.squidmath.OrderedMap;

025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Collection;

028/**
029 * Class for creating text blocks.
030 *
031 * This class defaults to having no padding and having no font set. You can use a
032 * default square or narrow font by calling the appropriate method, or set the font
033 * to any AngelCode bitmap font on the classpath (typically in libGDX, this would be
034 * in the assets folder; these fonts can be created by Hiero in the libGDX tools,
035 * see https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Hiero for more)
036 *
037 * After all settings are set, one of the initialization methods must be called
038 * before the factory can be used.
039 *
040 * In order to easily support Unicode, strings are treated as a series of code
041 * points.
042 *
043 * All images have transparent backgrounds.
044 *
045 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
046 * @author Tommy Ettinger
047 */
048public class TextCellFactory implements Disposable {
049
050    /**
051     * How many styles are supported by this TextCellFactory; always 1 unless changed in a subclass.
052     */
053    public int supportedStyles() {
054        return 1;
055    }
056    /**
057     * The commonly used symbols in roguelike games.
058     */
059    public static final String DEFAULT_FITTING =
060            " !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz{|}~";
061    /**
062     * All symbols that squidlib-util permits itself to generate; this is a shared subset across most of the larger
063     * fonts in {@link DefaultResources}.
064     */
065    public static final String SQUID_FITTING = StringKit.PERMISSIBLE_CHARS;
066    /**
067     * The {@link AssetManager} from where to load the font. Use it to share
068     * loading of a font's file across multiple factories.
069     */
070    protected /* Nullable */AssetManager assetManager;
071    public BitmapFont bmpFont;
072    protected TextureRegion block;
073    protected TextureRegion dirMarker;
074    protected String fitting = SQUID_FITTING;
075    protected IColorCenter<Color> scc;
076    protected int leftPadding, rightPadding, topPadding, bottomPadding;
077    protected float width = 1, height = 1;
078    public float actualCellWidth = 1, actualCellHeight = 1;
079    protected float distanceFieldScaleX = 36f, distanceFieldScaleY = 36f;
080    protected boolean initialized, initializedByFont, initializedBySize;
081    protected boolean distanceField;
082    protected boolean msdf;
083    /**
084     * For distance field and MSDF fonts, this is the ShaderProgram that will produce the intended effect.
085     * Usually should not be changed manually unless you know what you are doing.
086     */
087    public ShaderProgram shader;
088    protected float smoothingMultiplier = 1.2f;
089    protected float descent, lineHeight;
090    protected Label.LabelStyle style;
091    protected CharCharMap swap = new CharCharMap(8);
092    protected char directionGlyph = '^';
093    protected OrderedMap<Character, TextureRegion> glyphTextures = new OrderedMap<>(16);
094
095    protected StringBuilder mut = new StringBuilder(1).append('\0');
096
097    /**
098     * Creates a default valued factory. One of the initialization methods must
099     * be called before this factory can be used!
100     */
101    public TextCellFactory() {
102        this(null);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * A default valued factory that uses the given {@link AssetManager} to load
107     * the font file. Use this constructor if you are likely to load the same
108     * font over and over (recall that, without an {@link AssetManager}, each
109     * instance of {@link TextCellFactory} will load its font from disk). This
110     * primarily matters if you are using fonts not bundled with SquidLib, since
111     * accessing a BitmapFont with a method (not a String) from DefaultResources
112     * caches the BitmapFont already.
113     *
114     * @param assetManager an ordinary libGDX AssetManager
115     */
116    public TextCellFactory(/* Nullable */ AssetManager assetManager) {
117        this.assetManager = assetManager;
118        scc = DefaultResources.getSCC();
119        swap.defaultReturnValue('\uffff');
120        swap.put('\u0006', ' ');
121    }
122
123    public TextCellFactory copy()
124    {
125        TextCellFactory next = new TextCellFactory(assetManager);
126        if(bmpFont == null)
127            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
128        next.bmpFont = DefaultResources.copyFont(bmpFont);
129        next.block = block;
130        next.swap.clear();
131        next.swap.defaultReturnValue(swap.defaultReturnValue);
132        next.swap.putAll(swap);
133        next.distanceField = distanceField;
134        next.msdf = msdf;
135        next.distanceFieldScaleX = distanceFieldScaleX;
136        next.distanceFieldScaleY = distanceFieldScaleY;
137        next.shader = null;
138        next.fitting = fitting;
139        next.height = height;
140        next.width = width;
141        next.actualCellWidth = actualCellWidth;
142        next.actualCellHeight = actualCellHeight;
143        next.descent = descent;
144        next.lineHeight = lineHeight;
145        next.smoothingMultiplier = smoothingMultiplier;
146        next.scc = scc;
147        next.directionGlyph = directionGlyph;
148        if(initializedBySize)
149            next.initBySize();
150        else if(initializedByFont)
151            next.initByFont();
152        return next;
153    }
154    /**
155     * Initializes the factory to then be able to create text cells on demand.
156     * <br>
157     * Will match the width and height to the space width of the font and the
158     * line height of the font, respectively. Calling this after the factory
159     * has already been initialized will re-initialize it. This will not work
160     * with distance field or MSDF fonts; for those, use {@link #initBySize()}.
161     *
162     * @return this for method chaining
163     */
164    public TextCellFactory initByFont() {
165        if(bmpFont == null)
166            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
167        bmpFont.setFixedWidthGlyphs(fitting);
168        width = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance();
169        lineHeight = bmpFont.getLineHeight();
170        height = (lineHeight);
171        descent = bmpFont.getDescent();
172
173        actualCellWidth = width;
174        actualCellHeight = height;
175        BitmapFont.Glyph g = bmpFont.getData().missingGlyph;
176        if(g != null)
177        {
178            block = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(), g.srcX + 1, g.srcY + 1, 1, 1);
179        }
180        else {
181            Pixmap temp = new Pixmap(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
182            temp.setColor(Color.WHITE);
183            temp.fill();
184            Texture white = new Texture(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
185            white.draw(temp, 0, 0);
186            block = new TextureRegion(white);
187            temp.dispose();
188        }
189        style = new Label.LabelStyle(bmpFont, null);
190        BitmapFont.Glyph dg = bmpFont.getData().getGlyph(directionGlyph);
191        if(dg != null)
192            dirMarker = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(dg.page), dg.srcX, dg.srcY, dg.width, dg.height);
193        initialized = true;
194        initializedByFont = true;
195        return this;
196    }
197
198    /**
199     * Initializes the factory to then be able to create text cells on demand.
200     * <br>
201     * Will strictly use the provided width and height values to size the cells.
202     * Calling this after the factory has already been initialized will
203     * re-initialize it, but will re-create several objects (including compiling
204     * a ShaderProgram, which can be very challenging for a GPU to do each frame).
205     * If you need to re-initialize often to adjust size, use {@link #resetSize()},
206     * which does not allocate new objects if this was already initialized, and
207     * will just delegate to this method if this wasn't initialized.
208     *
209     * @return this for method chaining
210     */
211    public TextCellFactory initBySize() {
212        if(bmpFont == null)
213            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
214        BitmapFont.Glyph g = bmpFont.getData().missingGlyph;
215        if(g != null)
216        {
217            block = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(), g.srcX + 1, g.srcY + 1, 1, 1);
218        }
219        else {
220            Pixmap temp = new Pixmap(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
221            temp.setColor(Color.WHITE);
222            temp.fill();
223            Texture white = new Texture(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
224            white.draw(temp, 0, 0);
225            block = new TextureRegion(white);
226            temp.dispose();
227        }
228        if(msdf)
229        {
230            bmpFont.getData().setScale(width / distanceFieldScaleX, height / distanceFieldScaleY);
231
232            shader = new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.msdfFragmentShader);
233            if (!shader.isCompiled()) {
234                Gdx.app.error("shader", "Distance Field font shader compilation failed:\n" + shader.getLog());
235            }
236            //lineTweak = lineHeight / 20f;
237            //distanceFieldScaleX *= (((float)width) / height) / (distanceFieldScaleX / distanceFieldScaleY);
238        }
239        else if(distanceField)
240        {
241            bmpFont.getData().setScale(width / distanceFieldScaleX, height / distanceFieldScaleY);
242
243            shader = new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.fragmentShader);
244            if (!shader.isCompiled()) {
245                Gdx.app.error("shader", "Distance Field font shader compilation failed:\n" + shader.getLog());
246            }
247        }
248        else {
249            shader = FilterBatch.createDefaultShader();
250        }
251        lineHeight = bmpFont.getLineHeight();
252        descent = bmpFont.getDescent();
253        style = new Label.LabelStyle(bmpFont, null);
254        BitmapFont.Glyph dg = bmpFont.getData().getGlyph(directionGlyph);
255        if(dg != null)
256            dirMarker = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(dg.page), dg.srcX, dg.srcY, dg.width, dg.height);
257        initialized = true;
258        initializedBySize = true;
259        return this;
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Acts like calling {@link #initBySize()}, but doesn't create new ShaderPrograms or other objects if this has
264     * already been initialized. If this has not been initialized, simply returns initBySize(). This method is safe to
265     * call every frame if the font size continually changes, where initBySize() is not.
266     * @return this for chaining
267     */
268    public TextCellFactory resetSize()
269    {
270        return resetSize(width, height);
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Acts like calling {@link #width(float)}, {@link #height(float)}, and {@link #initBySize()} in succession, but
275     * doesn't create new ShaderPrograms or other objects if this has already been initialized. If this has not been
276     * initialized, calls width() and height() and then simply returns initBySize(). This method is safe to call every
277     * frame if the font size continually changes, where initBySize() is not.
278     * @param newWidth the new width of a single cell, as a float that usually corresponds to pixels
279     * @param newHeight the new height of a single cell, as a float that usually corresponds to pixels
280     * @return this for chaining
281     */
282    public TextCellFactory resetSize(final float newWidth, final float newHeight)
283    {
284        width(newWidth);
285        height(newHeight);
286        if(!initialized)
287            return initBySize();
288        if(msdf || distanceField)
289        {
290            bmpFont.getData().setScale(width / distanceFieldScaleX, height / distanceFieldScaleY);
291        }
292        lineHeight = bmpFont.getLineHeight();
293        descent = bmpFont.getDescent();
294
295        return this;
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Identical to {@link #initBySize()}.
300     *
301     * @see #initBySize() The docs for initBySize() apply here.
302     * @return this for method chaining
303     */
304    public TextCellFactory initVerbatim() {
305        return initBySize();
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Returns the {@link BitmapFont} used by this factory.
310     *
311     * @return the BitmapFont this uses
312     */
313    public BitmapFont font() {
314        return bmpFont;
315    }
316
317    /**
318     * Sets this factory to use the provided font.
319     *
320     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
321     * methods in this class.
322     *
323     * This should be called with an argument such as "Rogue-Zodiac-6x12.fnt", that is, it should have the .fnt
324     * extension as opposed to the .png that accompanies such a bitmap font. The bitmap font should be either in the
325     * internal folder that libGDX knows about, which means it is in the assets folder of your project usually.
326     * These BitmapFont resources are already known by SquidLib, but may need separate downloads (detailed in the linked
327     * DefaultResources documentation):
328     * <ul>
329     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt"</li>
330     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-6x12.fnt"</li>
331     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-6x16.fnt"</li>
332     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.fnt"</li>
333     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-24x24.fnt"</li>
334     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt"</li>
335     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-12x32.fnt"</li>
336     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt"</li>
337     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getExtraLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-18x36.fnt"</li>
338     * </ul>
339     * "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt", which is easily accessed by the field DefaultResources.narrowNameLarge , can also
340     * be set using TextCellFactory.defaultNarrowFont() instead of font(). "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt", also accessible
341     * as DefaultResources.squareName , can be set using TextCellFactory.defaultSquareFont() instead of font().
342     * "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt", also accessible as DefaultResources.smoothNameLarge , can be set using
343     * TextCellFactory.defaultFont() instead of font(). All three of these alternatives will cache the BitmapFont if
344     * the same one is requested later, but this font() method will not.
345     * <br>
346     * See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Hiero for some ways to create a bitmap font this can use. Several fonts
347     * in this list were created using Hiero (not Hiero4), and several were created with AngelCode's BMFont tool.
348     *
349     * @param fontpath the path to the font to use
350     * @return this factory for method chaining
351     */
352    public TextCellFactory font(String fontpath) {
353        if (assetManager == null) {
354            if (Gdx.files.internal(fontpath).exists())
355                bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(fontpath));
356            else if (Gdx.files.classpath(fontpath).exists())
357                bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.classpath(fontpath));
358            else
359                bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
360        }
361        else {
362            assetManager.load(new AssetDescriptor<>(fontpath, BitmapFont.class));
363            /*
364             * We're using the AssetManager not be asynchronous, but to avoid
365             * loading a file twice (because that takes some time (tens of
366             * milliseconds)). Hence this KISS code to avoid having to handle a
367             * not-yet-loaded font:
368             */
369            assetManager.finishLoading();
370            bmpFont = assetManager.get(fontpath, BitmapFont.class);
371        }
372        return this;
373    }
374    /**
375     * Sets this factory to use the provided BitmapFont as its font without re-constructing anything.
376     *
377     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
378     * methods in this class.
379     *
380     * This should be called with an argument such as {@code DefaultResources.getDefaultFont()} or any other variable
381     * with BitmapFont as its type. The bitmap font will not be loaded from file with this method, which it would be if
382     * you called the overload of font() that takes a String more than once. These BitmapFont resources are already
383     * known by SquidLib, but may need separate downloads (detailed in the linked DefaultResources documentation):
384     * <ul>
385     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt"</li>
386     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-6x12.fnt"</li>
387     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-6x16.fnt"</li>
388     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.fnt"</li>
389     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-24x24.fnt"</li>
390     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt"</li>
391     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-12x32.fnt"</li>
392     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt"</li>
393     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getExtraLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-18x36.fnt"</li>
394     * </ul>
395     * "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt", which is easily accessed by the method DefaultResources.getLargeNarrowFont() , can also
396     * be set using TextCellFactory.defaultNarrowFont() instead of font(). "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt", also accessible
397     * with DefaultResources.getDefaultFont() , can be set using TextCellFactory.defaultSquareFont() instead of font().
398     * "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt", also accessible with DefaultResources.getLargeSmoothFont() , can be set using
399     * TextCellFactory.defaultFont() instead of font(). All three of these alternatives will cache the BitmapFont if
400     * the same one is requested later, but this font() method will not.
401     * <br>
402     * See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Hiero for some ways to create a bitmap font this can use. Several fonts
403     * in this list were created using Hiero (not Hiero4), and several were created with AngelCode's BMFont tool.
404     *
405     * @param bitmapFont the BitmapFont this should use
406     * @return this factory for method chaining
407     */
408    public TextCellFactory font(BitmapFont bitmapFont) {
409        if (bitmapFont == null) {
410            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
411        }
412        else {
413            bmpFont = bitmapFont;
414        }
415        return this;
416    }
417
418    /**
419     * Sets the font to a distance field font with the given String path to a .fnt file and String path to a texture.
420     * Distance field fonts should scale cleanly to multiple resolutions without artifacts. Does not use AssetManager
421     * since you shouldn't need to reload the font if it scales with one image. You need to configure the shader to use
422     * distance field fonts unless a class already does this for you (SquidLayers handles shader configuration
423     * internally, for example). TextCellFactory has a method, configureShader(Batch), that does this and should be
424     * called while that Batch has begun rendering, typically in an override of some containing Scene2D Group's
425     * draw(Batch, float) method.
426     * <br>
427     * At least two distance field fonts are included in SquidLib; one is square, one is narrow, and they can both be
428     * accessed using either the predefined TextCellFactory objects in DefaultResources, accessible with
429     * getStretchableFont() for narrow or getStretchableSquareFont() for square, or the setter methods in this class,
430     * defaultDistanceFieldFont() for square and defaultNarrowDistanceFieldFont() for narrow.
431     * <br>
432     * To create distance field fonts that work well with monospace layout is... time-consuming and error-prone, though
433     * not especially difficult for most fonts. The process is documented as well as we can, given how differently all
434     * fonts are made, in a file not included in the distribution JAR but present on GitHub:
435     * <a href="https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/squidlib/etc/making-distance-field-fonts.txt">Instructions here</a>.
436     * A separate project is dedicated to automating this process somewhat,
437     * <a href="https://github.com/tommyettinger/Glamer">Glamer</a>; Glamer can also produce MSDF fonts.
438     * @param fontPath the path to a .fnt bitmap font file with distance field effects applied, which requires a complex
439     *                 process to create.
440     * @param texturePath the path to the texture used by the bitmap font
441     * @return this factory for method chaining
442     */
443    public TextCellFactory fontDistanceField(String fontPath, String texturePath) {
444        Texture tex;
445        if (Gdx.files.internal(texturePath).exists()) {
446            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font texture at " + texturePath);
447            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal(texturePath), false);
448            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
449        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath).exists()) {
450            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font texture at " + texturePath);
451            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath), false);
452            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
453        } else {
454            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
455            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + texturePath + ", using defaults");
456            return this;
457        }
458        if (Gdx.files.internal(fontPath).exists()) {
459            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font at " + fontPath);
460            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
461            distanceField = true;
462        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath).exists()) {
463            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font at " + fontPath);
464            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
465            distanceField = true;
466        } else {
467            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
468            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + fontPath + ", using defaults");
469        }
470        //bmpFont.getData().padBottom = bmpFont.getDescent();
471        distanceFieldScaleX = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance() - 1f;
472        distanceFieldScaleY = bmpFont.getLineHeight() - 1f;
473        return this;
474    }
475    /**
476     * @param fontPath the path to a .fnt bitmap font file with multi-channel distance field effects applied, which
477     *                 requires a complex process to create.
478     * @param texturePath the path to the texture used by the bitmap font
479     * @return this factory for method chaining
480     */
481    public TextCellFactory fontMultiDistanceField(String fontPath, String texturePath) {
482        Texture tex;
483        if (Gdx.files.internal(texturePath).exists()) {
484            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font texture at " + texturePath);
485            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal(texturePath), Pixmap.Format.RGB888, false);
486            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
487        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath).exists()) {
488            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font texture at " + texturePath);
489            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath), Pixmap.Format.RGB888, false);
490            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
491        } else {
492            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
493            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + texturePath + ", using defaults");
494            return this;
495        }
496        if (Gdx.files.internal(fontPath).exists()) {
497            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font at " + fontPath);
498            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
499            msdf = true;
500        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath).exists()) {
501            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font at " + fontPath);
502            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
503            msdf = true;
504        } else {
505            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
506            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + fontPath + ", using defaults");
507        }
508        //bmpFont.getData().padBottom = bmpFont.getDescent();
509        if(msdf)
510        {
511            bmpFont.getData().setScale(0.75f, 1f);
512        }
513        distanceFieldScaleX = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance() - 1f;
514        distanceFieldScaleY = bmpFont.getLineHeight() - 1f;
515        return this;
516    }
517    /**
518     * Sets this factory to use the one font included with libGDX, which is Arial at size 15 px. Does it correctly
519     * display when used in a grid? Probably not as well as you'd hope. You should probably get some of the assets that
520     * accompany SquidLib, and can be downloaded directly from GitHub (not available as one monolithic jar via Maven
521     * Central, but that lets you pick and choose individual assets). Get a .fnt and its matching .png file from
522     * https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/tree/master/assets and you can pass them to {@link #font(String)} or
523     * {@link #fontDistanceField(String, String)}.
524     *
525     * @return this factory for method chaining
526     */
527    public TextCellFactory includedFont()
528    {
529        bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
530        return this;
531    }/**
532     * Sets this factory to use a default 12x24 font that supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and many more, including
533     * box-drawing characters, zodiac signs, playing-card suits, and chess piece symbols. This is enough to support the
534     * output of anything that DungeonUtility can make for a dungeon or FakeLanguageGen can make for text with its
535     * defaults, which is difficult for any font to do. The box-drawing characters in this don't quite line up, and in
536     * some colors there may appear to be gaps (white text on black backgrounds will show it, but not much else).
537     *
538     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
539     * methods in this class.
540     *
541     * @return this factory for method chaining
542     */
543    public TextCellFactory defaultFont()
544    {
545        bmpFont = DefaultResources.getLargeSmoothFont();
546        return this;
547    }
548    /**
549     * Sets this factory to use a default 12x24 font that renders very accurately, with no gaps between box-drawing
550     * characters and very geometric lines.
551     *
552     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
553     * methods in this class.
554     *
555     * @return this factory for method chaining
556     */
557    public TextCellFactory defaultNarrowFont()
558    {
559        bmpFont = DefaultResources.getLargeNarrowFont();
560        return this;
561    }
562
563    /**
564     * Sets this factory to use a default 12x12 font, which... is square, and doesn't look as bad as many square fonts
565     * do, plus it supports box-drawing characters with no gaps.
566     *
567     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
568     * methods in this class.
569     *
570     * @return this factory for method chaining
571     */
572    public TextCellFactory defaultSquareFont()
573    {
574        bmpFont = DefaultResources.getDefaultFont();
575        return this;
576    }
577
578    /**
579     * Sets the TextCellFactory to use a square distance field font that will resize to whatever size you request.
580     * You must configure the shader if you use a distance field font, unless a class does it for you, like SquidLayers.
581     * The configureShader(Batch) method of this class can be used to set up the shader if you don't use SquidLayers;
582     * see its docs for more information.
583     * @return this TextCellFactory set to use a square distance field font
584     */
585    public TextCellFactory defaultDistanceFieldFont()
586    {
587        fontDistanceField(DefaultResources.distanceFieldSquare, DefaultResources.distanceFieldSquareTexture);
588        return this;
589    }
590    /**
591     * Sets the TextCellFactory to use a half-square distance field font that will resize to whatever size you request.
592     * You must configure the shader if you use a distance field font, unless a class does it for you, like SquidLayers.
593     * The configureShader(Batch) method of this class can be used to set up the shader if you don't use SquidLayers;
594     * see its docs for more information.
595     * @return this TextCellFactory set to use a half-square distance field font
596     */
597    public TextCellFactory defaultNarrowDistanceFieldFont()
598    {
599        fontDistanceField(DefaultResources.distanceFieldNarrow, DefaultResources.distanceFieldNarrowTexture);
600        return this;
601    }

603    /**
604     * Returns the width of a single cell.
605     *
606     * @return the width
607     */
608    public float width() {
609        return width;
610    }
611
612    /**
613     * Sets the factory's cell width to the provided value. Clamps at 1 on the
614     * lower bound to ensure valid calculations.
615     *
616     * @param width the desired width
617     * @return this factory for method chaining
618     */
619    public TextCellFactory width(float width) {
620        this.width = Math.max(1, width);
621        actualCellWidth = this.width;
622        return this;
623    }
624
625    /**
626     * Returns the height of a single cell.
627     *
628     * @return the height of a single cell
629     */
630    public float height() {
631        return height;
632    }
633
634    /**
635     * Sets the factory's cell height to the provided value. Clamps at 1 on the
636     * lower bound to ensure valid calculations.
637     *
638     * @param height the desired width
639     * @return this factory for method chaining
640     */
641    public TextCellFactory height(float height) {
642        this.height = Math.max(1, height);
643        //modifiedHeight = this.height;
644        actualCellHeight = this.height;
645        return this;
646    }
647    /**
648     * Sets the factory's height used for text to the provided value, but does not change the size of a cell. Clamps at
649     * 1 on the lower bound to ensure valid calculations.
650     *
651     * @param width the desired width
652     * @return this factory for method chaining
653     */
654    public TextCellFactory tweakWidth(float width) {
655        this.width = Math.max(1, width);
656        return this;
657    }
658
659    /**
660     * Sets the factory's height used for text to the provided value, but does not change the size of a cell. Clamps at
661     * 1 on the lower bound to ensure valid calculations.
662     *
663     * @param height the desired height
664     * @return this factory for method chaining
665     */
666    public TextCellFactory tweakHeight(float height) {
667        this.height = Math.max(1, height);
668        //modifiedHeight = this.height;
669        return this;
670    }
671
672    /**
673     * Returns the current String of code points that are used for sizing the
674     * cells.
675     *
676     * Note that this is actually a set of codepoints and treating them as an
677     * array of chars might give undesired results.
678     *
679     * @return the String used for sizing calculations
680     */
681    public String fit() {
682        return fitting;
683    }
684
685    /**
686     * Sets the characters that will be guaranteed to fit to the provided ones.
687     * This will override any previously set string.
688     *
689     * @param fit the String of code points to size to
690     * @return this factory for method chaining
691     */
692    public TextCellFactory fit(String fit) {
693        fitting = fit;
694        bmpFont.setFixedWidthGlyphs(fitting);
695        width = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance();
696        return this;
697    }
698
699    /**
700     * Adds the code points in the string to the list of characters that will be
701     * guaranteed to fit.
702     *
703     * @param fit the String of code points to size to
704     * @return this factory for method chaining
705     */
706    public TextCellFactory addFit(String fit) {
707        fitting += fit;
708        bmpFont.setFixedWidthGlyphs(fitting);
709        width = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance();
710        return this;
711    }
712
713    /**
714     * Returns whether this factory is currently set to do antialiasing on the
715     * characters rendered, which is always true.
716     *
717     * @return true if antialiasing is set, so, always
718     */
719    public boolean antialias() {
720        return true;
721    }
722
723    /**
724     * All fonts will be rendered with antialiasing, this doesn't do anything.
725     *
726     * @param antialias ignored, will always use antialiasing
727     * @return this factory for method chaining
728     * @deprecated AA is the wave of the future!
729     */
730    @Deprecated
731    public TextCellFactory antialias(boolean antialias) {
732        return this;
733    }

735    /**
736     * Sets the amount of padding on all sides to the provided value.
737     *
738     * @param padding how much padding in pixels
739     * @return this for method chaining
740     */
741    public TextCellFactory padding(int padding) {
742        leftPadding = padding;
743        rightPadding = padding;
744        topPadding = padding;
745        bottomPadding = padding;
746        return this;
747    }

829    /**
830     * @param icc
831     *            The color center to use. Should not be {@code null}.
832     * @return {@code this}
833     * @throws NullPointerException
834     *             If {@code icc} is {@code null}.
835     */
836    public TextCellFactory setColorCenter(IColorCenter<Color> icc) {
837        if (icc == null)
838            /* Better fail now than later */
839            throw new NullPointerException(
840                    "The color center should not be null in " + getClass().getSimpleName());
841        scc = icc;
842        return this;
843    }
844
845    /**
846     * Returns true if this factory is fully initialized and ready to build text cells.
847     *
848     * @return true if initialized
849     */
850    public boolean initialized() {
851        return initialized;
852    }
853
854    /**
855     * Returns true if the given character will fit inside the current cell
856     * dimensions with the current font.
857     *
858     * ISO Control characters, non-printing characters and invalid unicode
859     * characters are all considered by definition to fit.
860     *
861     * @param codepoint the codepoint of the char in question
862     * @return true if the char will fit, or if it is non-printing in some way; false otherwise
863     */
864    public boolean willFit(int codepoint) {
865        if (!initialized) {
866            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
867        }
868
869        if (!Character.isValidCodePoint(codepoint) ||
870                (codepoint <= 0x001F) || (codepoint >= 0x007F && codepoint <= 0x009F)) // same as isIsoControl
871        {
872            return true;
873        }
874
875        return fitting.contains(String.valueOf(Character.toChars(codepoint)));
876    }
877    
878    private char getOrDefault(final char toGet)
879    {
880        return swap.getOrDefault(toGet, toGet);
881    }
882    /**
883     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) with the default color
884     * (white), with x and y determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
885     *
886     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
887     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
888     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
889     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
890     */
891    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, float x, float y) {
892        if (!initialized) {
893            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
894        }
895
896        // + descent * 3 / 2f
897        // - distanceFieldScaleY / 12f
898
899        //height - lineTweak * 2f
900        if (s == null || s.length() == 0 || s.charAt(0) == 0) {
901            batch.setPackedColor(SColor.FLOAT_WHITE);
902            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // + descent * 1 / 3f
903        } else {
904            batch.setPackedColor(SColor.FLOAT_WHITE); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
905            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
906            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1/* * 1.5f*//* - lineHeight * 0.2f */ /* + descent*/, width, Align.center, false);
907        }
908    }
909
910
911    /**
912     * Use the specified Batch to draw a char with the default color (white), with x and y determining the world-space
913     * coordinates for the upper-left corner. If c is {@code '\0'}, will draw a solid white block instead.
914     *
915     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
916     * @param c the char to draw. Can be {@code '\0'} to draw a solid block instead.
917     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
918     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
919     */
920    public void draw(Batch batch, char c, float x, float y) {
921        if (!initialized) {
922            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
923        }
924
925        // + descent * 3 / 2f
926        // - distanceFieldScaleY / 12f
927
928        //height - lineTweak * 2f
929        if (c == 0) {
930            batch.setColor(1f,1f,1f,1f);
931            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // + descent * 1 / 3f
932        } else {
933            batch.setPackedColor(SColor.FLOAT_WHITE); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
934            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
935            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
936            bmpFont.draw(batch, mut, x, y - descent + 1/* * 1.5f*//* - lineHeight * 0.2f */ /* + descent*/, width, Align.center, false);
937        }
938    }
939    /**
940     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) in the specified rgba
941     * color, with x and y determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
942     *
943     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
944     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
945     * @param r 0.0f to 1.0f red value
946     * @param g 0.0f to 1.0f green value
947     * @param b 0.0f to 1.0f blue value
948     * @param a 0.0f to 1.0f alpha value
949     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
950     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
951     */
952    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, float r, float g, float b, float a, float x, float y) {
953        if (!initialized) {
954            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
955        }
956
957        if (s == null) {
958            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
959            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a);
960            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // descent * 1 / 3f
961            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
962        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
963            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
964            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a);
965            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight);
966            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
967        } else {
968            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
969            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
970            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
971        }
972    }
973
974    /**
975     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) in the specified libGDX
976     * Color, with x and y
977     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
978     *
979     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
980     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
981     * @param color the libGDX Color to draw the char(s) with, all the same color
982     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
983     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
984     */
985    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, Color color, float x, float y) {
986        if (!initialized) {
987            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
988        }
989
990        if (s == null) {
991            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
992            batch.setColor(color);
993            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
994            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
995        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
996            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
997            batch.setColor(color);
998            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight);
999            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1000        } else {
1001            batch.setColor(color); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1002            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1003            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1004        }
1005    }
1006    /**
1007     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) in the specified libGDX
1008     * Color, with x and y determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1009     *
1010     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1011     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1012     * @param encodedColor the libGDX Color to use, converted to float as by {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
1013     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1014     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1015     */
1016    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, float encodedColor, float x, float y) {
1017        if (!initialized) {
1018            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1019        }
1020
1021        if (s == null) {
1022            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1023            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1024            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1025            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1026        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1027            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1028            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1029            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight);
1030            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1031        } else
1032        {
1033            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1034            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1035            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1036        }
1037    }
1038
1039    /**
1040     * Use the specified Batch to draw a char in the specified libGDX Color, with x and y
1041     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1042     *
1043     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1044     * @param c the char to draw. Can be {@code '\0'} to draw a solid block instead.
1045     * @param color the libGDX Color (or SquidLib SColor) to use, as an object
1046     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1047     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1048     */
1049    public void draw(Batch batch, char c, Color color, float x, float y) {
1050        if (!initialized) {
1051            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1052        }
1053        if (c == 0) {
1054            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1055            batch.setColor(color);
1056            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1057            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1058        } else
1059        {
1060            batch.setColor(color); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1061            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1062            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1063            bmpFont.draw(batch, mut, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1064        }
1065    }

1067    /**
1068     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String (often just one char long) in the specified libGDX Color, with x and y
1069     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1070     *
1071     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1072     * @param c the char to draw. Can be {@code '\0'} to draw a solid block instead.
1073     * @param encodedColor the libGDX Color to use, converted to float as by {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
1074     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.

1080        }

1084            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1085            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1086        } else

1091            bmpFont.draw(batch, mut, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);

1095    /**
1096     * Use the specified Batch to draw a TextureRegion with the default tint color (white, so un-tinted), with x and y
1097     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner. The TextureRegion will be stretched
1098     * if its size does not match what this TextCellFactory uses for width and height.
1099     *
1100     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1101     * @param tr the TextureRegion to draw. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1102     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1103     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1104     */
1105    public void draw(Batch batch, TextureRegion tr, float x, float y) {
1106        if (!initialized) {
1107            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1108        }
1109
1110        if (tr == null) {
1111            batch.draw(block, x, y - height, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1112        } else {
1113            batch.draw(tr, x, y - height, width, height);
1114        }
1115    }
1116    /**
1117     * Use the specified Batch to draw a TextureRegion tinted with the specified rgba color, with x and y
1118     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner. The TextureRegion will be stretched
1119     * if its size does not match what this TextCellFactory uses for width and height.
1120     *
1121     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1122     * @param tr the TextureRegion to draw. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1123     * @param r 0.0 to 0.1 red value
1124     * @param g 0.0 to 0.1 green value
1125     * @param b 0.0 to 0.1 blue value
1126     * @param a 0.0 to 0.1 alpha value
1127     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1128     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1129     */
1130    public void draw(Batch batch, TextureRegion tr, float r, float g, float b, float a, float x, float y) {
1131        if (!initialized) {
1132            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1133        }
1134
1135        if (tr == null) {
1136            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1137            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a);
1138            batch.draw(block, x, y - height, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1139            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1140        } else {
1141            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1142            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a);
1143            batch.draw(tr, x, y - height, width, height);
1144            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1145        }
1146    }

1176    /**

1179     * if its size does not match what this TextCellFactory uses for width and height. Colors can be converted to and
1180     * from floats using methods in SColor such as {@link SColor#floatGet(float, float, float, float)},
1181     * {@link SColor#toFloatBits()}, {@link SColor#colorFromFloat(Color, float)}, and
1182     * {@link SColor#lerpFloatColors(float, float, float)}.

1185     * @param tr the TextureRegion to draw. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1186     * @param encodedColor the float encoding a color (as ABGR8888; SColor can produce these) to draw the image with
1187     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the image in world coordinates.
1188     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the image in world coordinates.
1189     */
1190    public void draw(Batch batch, TextureRegion tr, float encodedColor, float x, float y)
1191    {
1192        if (!initialized) {
1193            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");

1200            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1201        } else {

1203            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1204            batch.draw(tr, x, y - height, width, height);
1205            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1206        }
1207    }

1209    /**

1211     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner. The TextureRegion will be stretched
1212     * only if the supplied width and height do not match what its own dimensions are.
1213     *
1214     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1215     * @param tr the TextureRegion to draw. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1216     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1217     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1218     * @param width the width of the TextureRegion or solid block in pixels.
1219     * @param height the height of the TextureRegion or solid block in pixels.
1220     */
1221    public void draw(Batch batch, TextureRegion tr, float x, float y, float width, float height) {

1223            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1224        }
1225
1226        if (tr == null) {
1227            batch.draw(block, x, y - height, width, height);
1228        } else {
1229            batch.draw(tr, x, y - height, width, height);
1230        }

1297    /**
1298     * Use the specified Batch to draw a TextureRegion tinted with the specified libGDX Color, with x and y
1299     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner. The TextureRegion will be stretched
1300     * only if the supplied width and height do not match what its own dimensions are.
1301     *
1302     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1303     * @param tr the TextureRegion to draw. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1304     * @param encodedColor the float encoding a color (as ABGR8888; SColor can produce these) to draw the image with
1305     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the image in world coordinates.
1306     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the image in world coordinates.
1307     * @param width the width of the TextureRegion or solid block in pixels.
1308     * @param height the height of the TextureRegion or solid block in pixels.
1309     */
1310    public void draw(Batch batch, TextureRegion tr, float encodedColor, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
1311        if (!initialized) {
1312            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1313        }
1314
1315        if (tr == null) {
1316            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1317            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1318            batch.draw(block, x, y - height, width, height);
1319            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1320        } else {
1321            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1322            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1323            batch.draw(tr, x, y - height, width, height);
1324            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1325        }
1326    }
1327
1328    /**
1329     * Draws a 2D array of floats that represent encoded colors, with each float used for a block of color the size of
1330     * one character cell (it will be {@link #actualCellWidth} by {@link #actualCellHeight} in size, using world units).
1331     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1332     * @param encodedColors a 2D float array of encoded colors, each usually produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()} or an SColor method
1333     * @param x the x-position where this should render the block of many colors 
1334     * @param y the y-position where this should render the block of many colors
1335     */
1336    public void draw(Batch batch, float[][] encodedColors, float x, float y)
1337    {
1338        float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1339        final int w = encodedColors.length, h = encodedColors[0].length;
1340        float wm = x, hm;
1341        for (int i = 0; i < w; i++, wm += actualCellWidth) {
1342            hm = y + (h - 1) * actualCellHeight;
1343            for (int j = 0; j < h; j++, hm -= actualCellHeight) {
1344                if(encodedColors[i][j] == 0f)
1345                    continue;
1346                batch.setPackedColor(encodedColors[i][j]);
1347                batch.draw(block, wm, hm, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // descent * 1 / 3f
1348            }
1349        }
1350        batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1351    }
1352
1353    /**
1354     * Draws a 2D array of floats that represent encoded colors, with each float used for a block of color that will be
1355     * a fraction of the size of one character cell (it will be {@link #actualCellWidth} divided by {@code xSubCells} by
1356     * {@link #actualCellHeight} divided by {@code ySubCells} in size, using world units). Typically the 2D float array
1357     * should be larger than the 2D storage for text drawn over the colorful blocks (such as a 2D char array), since
1358     * more than one subcell may be drawn in the space of one character cell.
1359     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1360     * @param encodedColors a 2D float array of encoded colors, each usually produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()} or an SColor method
1361     * @param x the x-position where this should render the block of many colors 
1362     * @param y the y-position where this should render the block of many colors
1363     * @param xSubCells how many blocks of color should fit across the span of {@link #actualCellWidth}, each one float; must not be 0
1364     * @param ySubCells how many blocks of color should fit across the span of {@link #actualCellHeight}, each one float; must not be 0
1365     */
1366    public void draw(Batch batch, float[][] encodedColors, float x, float y, int xSubCells, int ySubCells)
1367    {
1368        float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1369        final int w = encodedColors.length, h = encodedColors[0].length;
1370        final float subW = actualCellWidth / xSubCells, subH = actualCellHeight / ySubCells;
1371        float wm = x, hm;
1372        for (int i = 0; i < w; i++, wm += subW) {
1373            hm = y + (h - 1) * subH;
1374            for (int j = 0; j < h; j++, hm -= subH) {
1375                if(encodedColors[i][j] == 0f)
1376                    continue;
1377                batch.setPackedColor(encodedColors[i][j]);
1378                batch.draw(block, wm, hm, subW, subH);
1379            }
1380        }
1381        batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1382    }
1383
1384    /**
1385     * Given a Pixmap and a 2D float array, uses each float in the array as an encoded color for a pixel in the Pixmap
1386     * at a location determined by the float's position in the array. This is meant to be used to draw backgrounds that
1387     * will be stretched by the {@link #actualCellWidth} and {@link #actualCellHeight} of this TextCellFactory.
1388     * <br>
1389     * Oddly, this doesn't seem to be very fast compared to {@link #draw(Batch, float[][], float, float)}, so if you
1390     * need to draw backgrounds then prefer that method (as SparseLayers does). It also doesn't work with a FilterBatch,
1391     * so if you want to use FloatFilter to adjust colors, you would need to use the other draw method for backgrounds.
1392     * @param pixmap a non-null Pixmap that will be modified
1393     * @param encodedColors a 2D float array that must be non-null and non-empty, and contains packed colors
1394     */
1395    public void draw(Pixmap pixmap, float[][] encodedColors)
1396    {
1397        final int w = Math.min(pixmap.getWidth(), encodedColors.length), h = Math.min(pixmap.getHeight(), encodedColors[0].length);
1398        for (int i = 0; i < w; i++) {
1399            for (int j = h - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
1400                if (encodedColors[i][j] == 0f)
1401                    continue;
1402                pixmap.drawPixel(i, j, NumberTools.floatToReversedIntBits(encodedColors[i][j]));
1403            }
1404        }
1405    }
1406
1407    /**
1408     * Converts a String into a Label, or if the argument s is null, creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1409     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects.
1410     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1411     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1412     */
1413    public Label makeWrappingString(String s) {
1414        if (!initialized) {
1415            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1416        }
1417        if (s == null) {
1418            s = "";
1419        }
1420        Label lb = new Label(s, style);
1421        lb.setWrap(true);
1422        // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1423        return lb;
1424
1425    }
1426
1427    /**
1428     * Converts a String into a Label, or if the argument s is null, creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1429     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose.
1430     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1431     * @param color a Color to tint s with.
1432     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1433     */
1434    public Actor makeActor(String s, Color color) {
1435        if (!initialized) {
1436            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1437        }
1438        if (s == null) {
1439            Image im = new Image(block);
1440            im.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1441            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1442            im.setSize(actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1443            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1444            return im;
1445        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1446            Image im = new Image(block);
1447            im.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1448            //im.setSize(width * s.length(), height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1449            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //   - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1450            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1451            return im;
1452        } else {
1453            Label lb = new Label(s, style);
1454            //lb.setFontScale(bmpFont.getData().scaleX, bmpFont.getData().scaleY);
1455            lb.setSize(width * s.length(), height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1456            lb.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1457            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1458            return lb;
1459        }
1460    }
1461
1462    /**
1463     * Converts a String into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument s is null, creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1464     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1465     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1466     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1467     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1468     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1469     * @param colors a List of Color to tint s with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1470     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1471     */
1472    public Actor makeActor(String s, Collection<Color> colors) {
1473        return makeActor(s, colors, 2f, false);
1474    }
1475    /**
1476     * Converts a String into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument s is null, creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1477     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1478     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1479     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1480     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1481     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1482     * @param colors a List of Color to tint s with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1483     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1484     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1485     */
1486    public Actor makeActor(String s, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
1487    {
1488        return makeActor(s, colors, loopTime, false);
1489    }
1490    /**
1491     * Converts a String into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument s is null, creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1492     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1493     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1494     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1495     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1496     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1497     * @param colors a List of Color to tint s with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1498     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1499     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1500     */
1501    public Actor makeActor(String s, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth) {
1502        if (!initialized) {
1503            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1504        }
1505        ArrayList<Color> colors2 = null;
1506        if(colors != null && !colors.isEmpty())
1507        {
1508            colors2 = new ArrayList<>(colors.size());
1509            for (Color c : colors) {
1510                colors2.add(scc.filter(c));
1511            }
1512        }
1513        if (s == null) {
1514            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1515            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1516            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1517            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1518            return im;
1519        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1520            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1521            //im.setSize(width * s.length(), height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1522            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * s.length() * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //   - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1523            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1524            return im;
1525        } else {
1526            ColorChangeLabel lb = new ColorChangeLabel(s, style, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1527            lb.setSize(width * s.length(), height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1528            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1529            return lb;
1530        }
1531    }
1532
1533    /**
1534     * Converts a char into a Label, or if the argument c is '\0', creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1535     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose.
1536     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1537     * @param color a Color to tint c with.
1538     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1539     */
1540    public Actor makeActor(char c, Color color) {
1541        if (!initialized) {
1542            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1543        }
1544        if (c == 0) {
1545            Image im = new Image(block);
1546            im.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1547            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1548            im.setSize(actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1549            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1550            return im;
1551        } else {
1552            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1553            Label lb = new Label(mut, style);
1554            lb.setSize(width, height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1555            lb.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1556            return lb;
1557        }
1558    }
1559
1560    /**
1561     * Converts a char into a Label, or if the argument c is '\0', creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1562     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. Instead of a libGDX Color
1563     * object, this takes an encoded float that represents a color as libGDX often does internally, ABGR-packed format.
1564     * You can use various methods in SColor to produce these, like {@link SColor#floatGet(float, float, float, float)}
1565     * or {@link Color#toFloatBits()}.
1566     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1567     * @param encodedColor an ABGR packed float (as produced by {@link SColor#floatGet(float, float, float, float)}) to use as c's color
1568     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1569     */
1570    public Actor makeActor(char c, float encodedColor) {
1571        if (!initialized) {
1572            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1573        }
1574        if (c == 0) {
1575            Image im = new Image(block);
1576            Color.abgr8888ToColor(im.getColor(), encodedColor);
1577            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1578            im.setSize(actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1579            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1580            return im;
1581        } else {
1582            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1583            Label lb = new Label(mut, style);
1584            //lb.setFontScale(bmpFont.getData().scaleX, bmpFont.getData().scaleY);
1585            lb.setSize(width, height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1586            Color.abgr8888ToColor(lb.getColor(), encodedColor);
1587            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1588            return lb;
1589        }
1590    }
1591
1592    /**
1593     * Converts a char into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument c is '\0', creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1594     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1595     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1596     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1597     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1598     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1599     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1600     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1601     */
1602    public Actor makeActor(char c, Collection<Color> colors) {
1603        return makeActor(c, colors, 2f, false);
1604    }
1605    /**
1606     * Converts a char into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument c is '\0', creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1607     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1608     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1609     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1610     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1611     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1612     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1613     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1614     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1615     */
1616    public Actor makeActor(char c, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
1617    {
1618        return makeActor(c, colors, loopTime, false);
1619    }
1620    /**
1621     * Converts a char into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument c is '\0', creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1622     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1623     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1624     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1625     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1626     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1627     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1628     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1629     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1630     */
1631    public Actor makeActor(char c, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth) {
1632        if (!initialized) {
1633            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1634        }
1635        ArrayList<Color> colors2 = null;
1636        if(colors != null && !colors.isEmpty())
1637        {
1638            colors2 = new ArrayList<>(colors.size());
1639            for (Color color : colors) {
1640                colors2.add(scc.filter(color));
1641            }
1642        }
1643        if (c == 0) {
1644            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1645            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1646            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1647            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1648            return im;
1649        } else {
1650            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1651            ColorChangeLabel lb = new ColorChangeLabel(mut, style, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1652            lb.setSize(width, height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1653            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1654            return lb;
1655        }
1656    }
1657    public Actor makeActor(TextureRegion tr, Collection<Color> colors)
1658    {
1659        return makeActor(tr, colors, 2f, false);
1660    }

1663        return makeActor(tr, colors, loopTime, false);

1665    /**
1666     * Converts a TextureRegion into a ColorChangeImage that will cycle through the given colors.
1667     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each loopTime, and are not affected by
1668     * setColor, though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation
1669     * for the purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1670     * @param tr a TextureRegion to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1671     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1672     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1673     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1674     */
1675    public Actor makeActor(TextureRegion tr, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth){
1676        return makeActor(tr, colors, loopTime, doubleWidth,
1677                actualCellWidth * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0));
1678    }

1680    /**
1681     * Converts a TextureRegion into a ColorChangeImage that will cycle through the given colors.
1682     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each loopTime, and are not affected by
1683     * setColor, though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation
1684     * for the purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1685     * @param tr a TextureRegion to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1686     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1687     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1688     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1689     */
1690    public Actor makeActor(TextureRegion tr, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth,
1691                           float width, float height){
1692        if (!initialized) {
1693            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1694        }
1695        ArrayList<Color> colors2 = null;
1696        if(colors != null && !colors.isEmpty())
1697        {
1698            colors2 = new ArrayList<>(colors.size());
1699            for (Color color : colors) {
1700                colors2.add(scc.filter(color));
1701            }
1702        }
1703        if (tr == null) {
1704            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1705            im.setSize(width, height);
1706            return im;
1707        } else {
1708            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(tr, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1709            im.setSize(width, height);
1710            return im;
1711        }
1712    }
